intro: Dalzellia ranongensis, commonly known as the Ranong dalzellia, is a flowering plant native to Thailand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
